pr_title: [ML] fix inference binary classification predication label and feature importance

timeline.message: [ML] fix feature importance calculation for binary classification

timeline.bodyText:
There is one place where this might cause a mistake.
Lets assume the class labels are something that are NOT true or false, taco and hamburger for classes 0 and 1 respectively
If the user SPECIFICALLY selects the boolean prediction value type on inference, it will flag as follows:
taco will be false (since it starts with t but is not the word true)
hamburger will be true (since it doesn't start with t or f, we revert to the class number).
To me, this is acceptable, as the user would have to specify the boolean result type. Knowing their classes labels were NOT actually boolean :/.
timeline.author: benwtrent
